dialogue.name: Sheldon
dialogue.text: I admit {satisfied} the design of Cookie Crush is quite elegant in its simplicity.

dialogue.name: Leonard
dialogue.text: That’s practically a compliment, Sheldon. {intrigued} Are you feeling okay?

dialogue.name: Penny
dialogue.text: Don’t worry, Leonard. He’s probably just trying to justify playing it himself.

dialogue.name: Sheldon
dialogue.text: Incorrect. {neutral} I’m studying its mechanics. The progression system is oddly satisfying.

dialogue.name: Penny
dialogue.text: It’s called fun, Sheldon. You should try it more often.

dialogue.name: Leonard
dialogue.text: She’s got a point. Sometimes, a simple game can be relaxing.

dialogue.name: Sheldon
dialogue.text: Relaxing? I suppose there’s merit in low-stakes gameplay to reduce cortisol levels.

dialogue.name: Penny
dialogue.text: Translation: Sheldon likes crushing cookies but won’t admit it. {laughing}

dialogue.name: Sheldon
dialogue.text: Fine. I find the color-matching oddly soothing. Happy?

dialogue.name: Leonard
dialogue.text: Very. Now we can finally play as a team in Wordscapes.

dialogue.name: Penny
dialogue.text: Wait, Sheldon’s doing team games now? What’s next, co-op decorating?

dialogue.name: Sheldon
dialogue.text: Unlikely. But if the design involves symmetry and efficiency, I may consider it.

dialogue.name: Penny
dialogue.text: See? Casual gaming brings people together!

dialogue.name: Leonard
dialogue.text: Even Sheldon. That’s a win for everyone. {win}

dialogue.name: Sheldon
dialogue.text: Agreed. {neutral} Though I still maintain chess simulators are superior.

dialogue.name: Penny
dialogue.text: Sure, Sheldon. {intrigued} You can play chess *after* we beat this next level.
